Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
ego \e"go\, n.; pl. {egos}. [L., I.] The conscious and permanent subject of all psychical experiences, whether held to be directly known or the product of reflective thought; the subject consciously considered as ``I'' by a person; -- opposed to {non-ego}. [1913 Webster +PJC]
2. (Psychoanalysis) that one of the three parts of a person's psychic apparatus that mediates consciously between the drives of the id and the realities of the external physical and social environment, by integrating perceptions of the external world and organizing the reactions to it. Contrasted with the {id} and {superego}. [PJC]
3. egotism; as, a job requiring a diplomat without too much ego. [PJC]
4. self-esteem; as, he has an overinflated ego. [PJC]
ego n 1: an inflated feeling of pride in your superiority to others [syn: {egotism}, {self-importance}] 2: your consciousness of your own identity [syn: {self}] 3: (psychoanalysis) the conscious mind
